response.answer_text: Hi my dear friend, the competition of NEET becomes extremely tough. Since today’s competition is so high for which you must target to score 330+ at least. Only NCERT books are not sufficient to score. Need some extra effort to score such higher score. What’s essential to mention The study procedures of NCERT books matters a lotWhat’s the beauty of NCERT at Your Fingertips that you need to understand, why other books aren’t good enough rather parallel oneThe NCERT at Your Fingertips help you to prepare your study of NCERT books line by line for NEET exam. This book contains short notes of the chapters too. Any chapter wise book is to study during your initial preparation time mainly. The latest version includes some good colourful images / diagrams. Procedure to follow: After getting the concept, then go through entire chapters line by line, word by word, after you think you are 100% confident enough to answer all questions, you solve “NCERT at Your Fingertips”. Mark or highlighting those lines in your NCERT which went wrong. Second time you have to cover up. Previous years’ question papers: In today’s scenario both NEET, AIPMT, AIIMS papers to solve. It’s no clearly mentioned. Again while you will be stuck solving those questions again you need to open NCERT question by question. Like this way your NCERT books will be becoming bible for you, you can understand your strength and weakness of yours. The point to mention here is … not the missing ones… it’s to be added…. While you will be appearing in any online test series specifically for Allen and Aakash Test Series same way you have to open again your NCERT books and need to highlight there. Finally what’re the other essential things to mention to complete this answer…. Additional points from your class notes, Trueman’s biology, coaching institute’s study materials to add in your NCERT books.Few times you need to labelling thr diagrams and images in your books using pencilPaste some sticky notes ( the extra points) in your NCERT books tooHopefully rather surely you will be becoming the master by revising some significant times of your own ornamented books . All the best!

Yeah, ncert biology will be a good shot for a mark in the range of 291–300 in biology. I personally studied only class 11 and 12 ncert biology and managed to score 301 in neet 2019. The real thing is that you have to study it deeply and identify those hidden concepts in the text. Sometimes, when the concept is tough to understand we tend to mug up the lines. This mistake should not be commited and maximum efforts must be put on to understand the underlying concepts. I was actually preparing by self so I relied wholly on internet (youtube especially) for clearing my concepts. The second important thing is correlation. Every chapter is correlated to each other especially in class 11 biology. When you are able to correlate between chapters it indicates that your study is complete. I also bought the book ‘ncert at your fingertips’. But ended up not even solving a single question in it. For biology, personally i felt that practising MCQs is not that important so I invested all my time for studying rather than solving MCQs. And finally dont fear to study only ncert. I feared a lot at the start whether I would score well by studying only ncert. I had peer pressure obviously from my friends who went to institutes and were studying much more in biology. Still, I managed to get a good score only with ncert. All the best and thumbs up for those NEET 2020 aspirants. Enjoy your studies, maintain your calm and dont lose hope during any point of your preparation.
